verses.verse: ([A Psalm] of David.) Blessed <WH1288> be the Lord, <WH3068> my rock, <WH6697> Who trains <WH3925> my hands <WH3027> for war, <WH7128> [And] my fingers <WH676> for battle; <WH4421>

My lovingkindness <WH2617> and my fortress, <WH4686> My stronghold <WH4869> and my deliverer; <WH6403> My shield <WH4043> and He in whom I take <WH2620> refuge; <WH2620> Who subdues <WH7286> my people <WH5971> under <WH8478> me.
O Lord, <WH3068> what <WH4100> is man, <WH120> that Thou dost take <WH3045> knowledge <WH3045> of him? Or the son <WH1121> of man, <WH582> that Thou dost think <WH2803> of him?
Man <WH120> is like <WH1819> a mere <WH1892> breath; <WH1892> His days <WH3117> are like a passing <WH5674> shadow. <WH6738>
Bow <WH5186> Thy heavens, <WH8064> O Lord, <WH3068> and come <WH3381> down; <WH3381> Touch <WH5060> the mountains, <WH2022> that they may smoke. <WH6225>
Flash <WH1299> forth <WH1299> lightning <WH1300> and scatter <WH6327> them; Send <WH7971> out Thine arrows <WH2671> and confuse <WH2000> them.

Stretch <WH7971> forth <WH7971> Thy hand <WH3027> from on high; <WH4791> Rescue <WH6475> me and deliver <WH5337> me out of great <WH7227> waters, <WH4325> Out of the hand <WH3027> of aliens <WH1121> <WH5236>
Whose <WH834> mouths <WH6310> speak <WH1696> deceit, <WH7723> And whose right <WH3225> hand <WH3225> is a right <WH3225> hand <WH3225> of falsehood. <WH8267>
I will sing <WH7891> a new <WH2319> song <WH7892> to Thee, O God; <WH430> Upon a harp <WH5035> of ten <WH6218> strings <WH6218> I will sing <WH2167> praises <WH2167> to Thee,
Who dost give <WH5414> salvation <WH8668> to kings; <WH4428> Who dost rescue <WH6475> David <WH1732> His servant <WH5650> from the evil <WH7451> sword. <WH2719>

Rescue <WH6475> me, and deliver <WH5337> me out of the hand <WH3027> of aliens, <WH1121> <WH5236> Whose <WH834> mouth <WH6310> speaks <WH1696> deceit, <WH7723> And whose right <WH3225> hand <WH3225> is a right <WH3225> hand <WH3225> of falsehood. <WH8267>
Let our sons <WH1121> in their youth <WH5271> be as grown-up plants, <WH5195> And our daughters <WH1323> as corner <WH2106> pillars fashioned <WH2404> as for a palace; <WH1964>

[Let] our garners <WH4200> be full, <WH4392> furnishing <WH6329> every <WH2177> kind <WH2177> of produce, [And] our flocks <WH6629> bring <WH503> forth <WH503> thousands <WH505> and ten <WH9539> thousands <WH9539> in our fields; <WH2351>
[Let] our cattle <WH9017> bear, <WH5445> Without <WH369> mishap <WH6556> and without <WH369> loss, <WH3318> [Let there be] no <WH369> outcry <WH6682> in our streets! <WH7339>
How blessed <WH835> are the people <WH5971> who <WH7945> are so <WH3602> situated; How blessed <WH835> are the people <WH5971> whose <WH7945> God <WH430> is the Lord! <WH3068>
